conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to explain features slowly and clearly for learning, while User Story B wants ALFRED not to provide detailed explanations and avoid extra information. These goals cannot both be met at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: Explain ALFRED features slowly during use
Do not provide detailed explanations of features
Explain ALFRED features clearly to avoid confusion
Allow users to use ALFRED without extra information
userStoryASummary: As an older person I want ALFRED to explain its features slowly and clearly so I can learn without feeling lost.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want ALFRED not to explain its features in detail because I just want to use it without extra information.
resolutionDescription: Adjusted both stories to apply different explanation modes based on user preference and learning stage, allowing clear slow explanations when learning and minimal info when experienced.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult learning ALFRED, I want it to explain features slowly and clearly, so I can understand without confusion.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Provide slow explanations of features during learning
Use clear language to avoid confusion
newUserStoryBSummary: As an experienced older adult, I want ALFRED to avoid detailed explanations and provide only necessary information, so I can use it quickly.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Do not provide detailed feature explanations for experienced users
Limit information to what is necessary for task completion
